sub_title: Principal geophysicist at Shell Global Solutions
summary:
Shell Principal Science Expert in geophysics possessing a strong work ethic, a broad mathematical and geophysics background, as well as extensive research experience in seismic processing, seismic interpretation, and quantitative interpretation of seismic data.

Stéphane Gesbert received a MS (1986) in Applied Physics from the Paris VII U., and graduated in civil engineering (1989) from the Ecole Nationale Supérieure des Mines de Paris. He worked two years for medical imaging company Sopha Medical in Canada and in France. In 1991, he joined Shell E&P, where he carried out R&D in the areas of seismic data filtering, interpolation, true-amplitude imaging, volume interpretation, and quantitative interpretation. From 2007 to 2009, he led the Subtle Traps R&D team. Stéphane Gesbert is currently working on advanced interpretation techniques and workflows.

Specialties: R&D in Image processing, Seismic processing, Volume Interpretation, Quantitative Interpretation, and Seismic Interpretation.
